isis.stitle: TSI 04-12-29 - Priming Fuel System after Running Out of Fuel

subjectgroup.subject: Priming Fuel System after Running Out of Fuel

geninfo.para: This TSI provides instructions on how to prime the fuel system after running out of fuel.

svcproc.title: Priming Fuel System

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is set and wheels are blocked before doing diagnostic or service procedures on engine or vehicle.
To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, make sure that the engine has cooled down sufficiently before attempting to prime the fuel system.
To avoid personal injury be sure to follow the safety procedures outlined in the "Safety Information" section of the Diagnostic Manual.

To avoid serious personal injury or possible death: do not allow engine fuel to stay on your skin. Clean your skin and nails with soap and water, or a good hand cleaner. Wash or properly throw away clothing or rags containing used engine fuel. Used engine fuel contains certain elements that may be unhealthy for skin.

caution.para: Do not add fuel to the fuel filter header, this can add contaminants to the fuel.

svcproc.para: If the engine runs out of fuel, do the following:

step1.para: Set parking brake and place transmission control lever to NEUTRAL or PARK.
Fill the fuel tank with 15 to 19 liters (4 to 5 gallons) of fuel.

note.para: If your vehicle is equipped with dual fuel tanks, fill each tank with 15 to 19 liters (4 to 5 gallons) of fuel.

step1.para: Unlock the fuel primer pump assembly (5, Figure 1) by turning the knob counter-clockwise.
Fill the fuel filter header and fuel rail by pumping the fuel primer pump.

item.para: Push the fuel primer pump until the pressure has built up enough that the knob cannot be pushed anymore. Be sure the fuel primer pump knob is pushed in when finished pumping. It is not necessary to lock the fuel primer knob at this time. If the fuel primer pump knob is hard to push, do steps 10, 11, and 12. If the fuel primer pump knob is easy to push, do step 4B.
If very little pressure is felt after pushing the knob of the fuel primer pump several times, air has to be bled out of the fuel rail. Do steps 5 through 12.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses with side shields when performing the following procedure.

caution.para: Be sure to place a rag or suitable container under the fuel pressure test valve when bleeding the fuel rail. Dispose of fuel in a correct container clearly marked DIESEL FUEL according to local regulations.

note.para: Engine fuel can be a threat to the environment. Never dispose of engine fuel by putting it in the trash, pouring on the ground, in the sewers, in streams, or bodies of water.

step1.para: Place either a shop rag or suitable container under the fuel pressure test valve (6, Figure 1). Engines are equipped with a fuel pressure test valve in the form of either a Shrader valve (Figure 2) or a diagnostic coupling (Figure 3).
Depress and hold the center stem or center section of the fuel pressure test valve and pump the fuel primer pump knob until a steady stream of fuel flows out the test valve.

note.para: It is recommended to use the Fuel Pressure Test Adapter to avoid bending the needle in the Shrader valve. The Fuel Pressure Test Adapter is part of Fuel Pressure Test Kit ZTSE4657.

step1.para: Once air has been released and fuel flows from the fuel pressure test valve, release the stem or center section. Remove the Fuel Pressure Test Adapter, if used.
Dispose of fuel in a correct container clearly marked DIESEL FUEL according to local regulations.

Push the fuel primer pump knob until the pressure has built up enough that the fuel primer pump knob cannot be pushed anymore. Be sure the fuel primer pump knob is pushed in when finished pumping. It is not necessary to lock the fuel primer pump knob at this time. Do steps 10, 11, and 12.
Start the engine. It is not necessary to lock the fuel primer pump knob of the fuel primer pump to start the engine.
If the engine does not start in 20 seconds, repeat the priming procedure.
Once the engine starts, let it run for five to 10 seconds, then shut-off the engine. Turn the fuel primer pump knob clockwise to lock in place.
